did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Nansemond County (Va.) Circuit Court Records, 1866-1922, Local government records collection, Suffolk (City) Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a shipment of court papers from Suffolk (City).

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Nansemond County was created as Upper Norfolk County by 1640 and in 1642 was renamed Nansemond County for the Nansemond Indians, who lived in the area in the early seventeenth century. The county seat was Suffolk. The county became the independent city of Nansemond on 1 July 1972, and on 1 January 1974 Nansemond merged with the city of Suffolk. The entire area is now known as Suffolk.

Created as Upper Norfolk County by 1640 and renamed Nansemond in 1646. Records were destroyed in three separate fires: the earliest consumed the house of the court clerk in April 1734 (where the records were kept at that time), the second was set by British troops in 1779, and the last occurred on 7 February 1866.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Nansemond County (Va.) Circuit Court Records, 1866-1922, consist of a Cash Book, Chancery Dockets, Chancery Executions, Chancery Rules, Clerk's Daybooks, Common Law Dockets, Fee Books, Memorandum Book, Moneys Deposited by Order of the Court, Process Books, and a Witness Attendance Book.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Nansemond County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"

Nansemond County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Nansemond County Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Database found at the Library of Virginia web site.
